Get the sentiment measures

Source: R/sentomeasures_methods.R
as.data.table.sento_measures.Rd

Extracts the sentiment measures data.table in either wide (by default) or long format.

# S3 method for sento_measures
as.data.table(x, keep.rownames = FALSE, format = "wide", ...)

Arguments

x

a sento_measures object created using sento_measures.
keep.rownames

see as.data.table.
format

a single character vector, one of c("wide", "long").
...

not used.

Value

The panel of sentiment measures under sento_measures[["measures"]], in wide or long format.

Examples

data("usnews", package = "sentometrics")
data("list_lexicons", package = "sentometrics")
data("list_valence_shifters", package = "sentometrics")

sm <- sento_measures(sento_corpus(corpusdf = usnews[1:200, ]),
                     sento_lexicons(list_lexicons["LM_en"]),
                     ctr_agg(lag = 3))

data.table::as.data.table(sm)
#>            date LM_en--wsj--equal_weight LM_en--wapo--equal_weight
#>   1: 1995-01-04              0.000000000              -0.003129890
#>   2: 1995-01-05              0.006060606              -0.004950495
#>   3: 1995-01-06              0.006060606              -0.004950495
#>   4: 1995-01-07              0.006060606              -0.004950495
#>   5: 1995-01-08              0.000000000               0.004357298
#>  ---                                                              
#> 370: 1996-01-08             -0.005102041              -0.018939394

#> 374: 1996-01-12              0.000000000              -0.012002494
#>      LM_en--economy--equal_weight LM_en--noneconomy--equal_weight

#> 372:                  0.000000000                   -0.0351911081
#> 373:                  0.000000000                   -0.0300890673

data.table::as.data.table(sm, format = "long")
